file_content.text: Moff Jiak extends his most humble thanks and appreciation for your work against Directive Seven.
Moff Jiak hopes you will assist him against the renegade droids of Directive Seven.
Verifying identity... complete. Please stand by for official communication from the Citadel.
Ah--my lord. I appreciate your indulgence. I am Moff Jiak. I would like to request your assistance in an urgent operation.
Hunter. I'm Moff Jiak. I require your services--urgently.
Ah, good--the best of Imperial Intelligence remains, even if the organization does not. I'm Moff Jiak. I have dire need of your assistance.
Eighty-seven hours ago, the Fifth Naval Patrol Group was attacked. All hands were lost--1,239 servicemen total.
Has the Republic developed some kind of new weapon? A new ship class?
The Republic?
No. This attack was not carried out by Republic forces.
It is always a great shame to lose so many to the enemy.
I'm sorry to hear that.
A lot of losses--that's a real shame.
That's pretty rough.
We're at war. People are killed all the time.
So what?
Giving up one's life in combat with the enemy is one thing. But that is not what happened here.
Our servicemen were slaughtered by their own droids... we found the corpses orbiting in perfect rings around Aduba.
Aren't droids programmed to be loyal? How could they rebel like that?
How is that possible?
We believe they were compelled to do so by a third party.
Is it possible the Republic tampered with our droids somehow?
Sounds like enemy sabotage.
We have investigated the matter thoroughly--the Republic was not involved. In fact, they seem to be facing similar circumstances.
Faulty droids are a problem for technicians, not me.
Fixing droids isn't my job.
Are you even listening? This was a coordinated mass-murder, not some behavioral glitch!
The attack on our ships was not an isolated incident. Droids elsewhere have disappeared or sabotaged our efforts.
All of these incidents have been linked to a secret movement calling itself "Directive Seven"--a cadre of rogue droids that plans to exterminate all life in the galaxy.
Steel and circuits are no match for the power of the dark side.
They won't succeed.
I hope you're right.
Wholesale galactic genocide is rather a high goal to set, isn't it?
Can they manage it?
Our intelligence suggests that the goal is well within their reach.
What's the bottom line? Find the droids' leader and take him down?
Where do I come in?
In the broad strokes--yes.
What more do we know about Directive Seven? Can we move against them?
How do we proceed?
We have no other option.
How am I only learning about these renegade droids now?
I should've heard this sooner.
No one suspected they could be capable of so much. We've tried to keep the situation under wraps to avoid a panic.
There's no way a pack of messed up droids could wipe out the entire galaxy.
That's nonsense.
We have extensive intelligence that suggests otherwise.
Time is against us--the renegades are already beginning to put their genocidal plans into motion. We must act now.
I am organizing a strike against Directive Seven's headquarters, to begin as soon as possible. I would like you to spearhead the operation.
I would be honored to destroy this threat to our Empire.
Of course.
Just give me the details, and I'll give you a pack of smashed droids.
It's a deal.
Smashing renegade droids could be fun for a while. I'm in.
Sure, why not?
I hope you take the situation more seriously once you're in the field.
I may not have time to help.
I understand, of course. But I hope you will consider this matter a top priority.
I am currently headquartered on the Imperial fleet. Come to the coordinates provided, and I will brief you more fully on the operation.
I hope to see you soon.
The connection has been closed. Thank you for your time.
Good day.
